approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: Develop a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team to access and download recordings for audit purposes.
project_goals: Provide V-KYC team with direct access to recordings.
Reduce dependency on IT for retrieving recordings.
approval_data.business_context: Currently, the V-KYC team relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings stored on the LTF NFS server. This process is manual and time-consuming. This project aims to streamline the process by providing a self-service portal.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard should be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal should be provided to Team Leads and Process Managers.
Recordings should be searchable by LAN ID.
Recordings should be available date and month wise.
Users should be able to upload a file (CSV/TXT) with a list of LAN IDs to download recordings in bulk.
The system should process the uploaded file and display results in a tabular format with a 'Download All' option.
The table should have pagination displaying 10 records at a time.
Bulk download should download a maximum of 10 records at a time.
The file upload should accept a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 50 LAN IDs.
The recording download should start upon clicking the LAN ID.
The access for the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders)

functional_requirements: Filtering and sorting by date and month.
Display of recording details (User ID, Call Duration, Status, Time, Date, NFS VKYC Upload Time).
non_functional_requirements: The system should be accessible to authorized users only.
The system should be secure and protect sensitive data.
The system should be available during business hours.
The system should have a user-friendly interface.
success_criteria: The portal is successfully deployed and accessible.
Users can easily search and download recordings.
The process of retrieving recordings is faster and more efficient.
constraints: Recordings are stored on the LTF NFS server.
Limited access to the portal for security reasons.
assumptions: The existing infrastructure (NFS server, network) is stable and reliable.
The necessary APIs for accessing the recordings are available.
Users have the required training to use the portal.
risks: Technical issues with the NFS server.

recommendations: Include details about the API integration.
Specify the expected performance metrics (e.g., download speed).
Add details about error handling and logging.

recommendations_for_completion: Define the API endpoints and data formats.
Specify the expected response times and download speeds.
Detail the error handling mechanisms and logging procedures.
